intro: Pavetta ruahaensis, commonly known as Ruaha pavetta, is a shrub native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in rocky and sandy soils, often in woodland or savanna habitats. It features opposite, elliptical leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences, and the plant produces small, fleshy berries as fruit.
